name: Trinabh Gupta
content: Trinabh Gupta Trinabh Gupta Associate Professor Department of Computer Science University of California, Santa Barbara trinabh@cs.ucsb.edu +1 916-850-5436 I am an associate professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB). Before joining UCSB, I was a postdoctoral researcher in the Systems Security and Privacy research group at Microsoft Research, Redmond where I spent one year. I received my PhD in Computer Science from The University of Texas at Austin, where I was advised by Michael Walfish and Lorenzo Alvisi. Research Interests My research interests are in computer systems, security, and privacy. I especially enjoy taking theoretical constructs from the literature on cryptography (e.g., private information retrieval and homomorphic encryption) and carefully applying them to add strong privacy guarantees to computer systems. Teaching CS170 (Undergraduate) Operating Systems: Winter 2019, Spring 2020, Fall 2020, Winter 2022, Winter 2023 CS178 (Undergraduate) Cryptography: Winter 2021, Fall 2022 CS293G (Graduate) Computing on encrypted data: Spring 2019, Winter 2020, Spring 2021, Spring 2022, Spring 2023 Publications HADES: Range-Filtered Private Aggregation on Public Data Xiaoyuan Liu, Ni Trieu, Trinabh Gupta, Ishtiyaque Ahmad, and Dawn Song International Conference on Very Large Data Bases VLDB 2025, London, UK, September 2025.
